BXDatabaseObjectModel Class Reference
BaseTen

Overview

The database object model.

A database object model stores the entity descriptions for a database at a certain URI.

Note
This class is thread-safe.

Instance Methods

(NSArray *) - entities
 
(NSDictionary *) - entitiesBySchemaAndName:reload:error:
 
(BXEntityDescription *) - entityForTable:
 
(BXEntityDescription *) - entityForTable:inSchema:
 

Method Documentation

- (NSArray *) entities

All entities found in the database.

Entities in private and metadata schemata won't be included.

Parameters
outErrorIf an error occurs, this pointer is set to an NSError instance. May be NULL.
Returns
An NSArray containing BXEntityDescriptions.
- (NSDictionary *) entitiesBySchemaAndName: (BXDatabaseContext *)  context
reload: (BOOL)  shouldReload
error: (NSError **)  outError 

All entities found in the database.

Entities in private and metadata schemata won't be included.

Parameters
reloadWhether the entity list should be reloaded.
outErrorIf an error occurs, this pointer is set to an NSError instance. May be NULL.
Returns
An NSDictionary with NSStrings corresponding to schema names as keys and NSDictionarys as objects. Each of them will have NSStrings corresponding to relation names as keys and BXEntityDescriptions as objects.
- (BXEntityDescription *) entityForTable: (NSString *)  name
inSchema: (NSString *)  schemaName 

Entity for a table in the given schema.

Note
Unlike PostgreSQL, leaving schemaName unspecified does not cause the search path to be used but instead will search the public schema.
